metadata.title: CVE-2021-3181 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: rfc822.c in Mutt through 2.0.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (mailbox unavailability) by sending email messages with sequencesof semicolon characters in RFC822 address fields (aka terminators of emptygroups). A small email message from the attacker can cause large memoryconsumption, and the victim may then be unable to see email messages fromother persons.

criterions.comment: mutt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
